node.html:
Full stack dApp on the Ethereum blockchain with React, Solidity, Hardhat, and Ethers.js.

This covers:

  • How to create, deploy, and test Ethereum smart contracts to local, test, and mainnet.
  • How to switch between local, test, and production environments / networks.
  • How to connect to and interact with the contracts using various environments from a front end like React.
Github pages deployment of a simple machine learning model that uses MNIST database for digit recognition using TensorFlow.js.

Machine Learning Engineering for Production (MLOps) Coursera Specialization

Some notes I've been taking for Andrew Ng's MLOps course specialization along with exercise notebooks.
Giving a presentation about MicroFrontends using Bit.dev.
Building UI components using Typescript using Bit.dev.
A minimal working project that handles several pseudoterminals running Julia on React. It's UI design is based on VSCode and Atom IDEs.
General Load Balancer Pattern implementation for ZMQ.

A minimal working project that generates background task queues that are distributed in different Julia workers using RabbitMQ.

Note: The webpage might be showing an error message because the dyno workers deployed in Heroku are turned off.
Building my projects page using Gatsby.
Building a blog where I write about the things I am learning during French classes using Gatsby and Typescript.
Building a blog where I write about the things I am learning during Violin classes and more using Gatsby and Typescript.
Building my personal page using GitHub Pages. In this page I link to all my blogs, cv and projects.

A minimal working project that handles Microsoft's Monaco Editor on the web with Julia's syntax highlighting and a dedicated Julia Language Server that allows a certain user to have full access to package documentation, suggestion and snippets.
Software that tests different transport libraries/communications (WebSockets, ZeroMQ, TCP) between different Backends like Julia, Node.js and Python.
Building my personal blog using Gatsby and Typescript. I generally talk about random stuff like cooking and travels.
Jupyter Notebooks used for studying Machine Learning concepts.
My notes and exercises for the Andrew Ng's Machine Learing course.
Some neural networks code I've been doing for Andrew Ng's Deep Learning course.
Building my personal blog using Gatsby and Typescript. I generally talk about random stuff like cooking and travels.
Developing a Monte Carlo simulation in order to quantify sensitivity and the detection efficiency of a radiotelescope under several possible configurations.

frontmatter.title: Study of Supernova Remnant RX J1713.7-3946

node.html:
The non-thermal emission of the supernova remnant RX J1713.7-3946 was studied, supposing relativistic proton and electron interactions with matter, photons from the CMB and magnetic field, with the goal of explaining the observed spectral energy distribution (SED).

This was made as the final project for the course Introduction to Relativistic Astrophysics.
Created an Hexapod Robot during my last year in High School.
